text.title: CLEAN AIR ACT
text.body: Upper layers of the core show the effects of human activity, including the release of pollutants like sulfates. Sulfate emissions began increasing in the early 1900s, but started to decline in the 1980s. This reflects international efforts to curb pollution, including the U.S. Clean Air Act passed in 1970.
text.description: Global efforts including the U.S. Clean Air Act have reduced industrial sulfate pollution.
